intro: Anthemis cairica, commonly known as the New Zealand dandelion, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Anthemis cairica is often used in traditional Māori medicine for its purported healing properties.
